s2.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Start the engine and idle it.
Select the Active Test mode on the intelligent tester.

atten4.ptxt: Please refer to the intelligent tester operator's manual for further details.

atten3.ptxt: Do not keep a motor relay on for more than 5 seconds. When operating it consecutively, wait 20 seconds between each operation.

s2.ptxt: Turn the motor relay on and check the actuator motor operation noise.
Fully depress the brake pedal and hold it for approximately 15 seconds. Check that the pedal's initial depth is maintained for the entire 15 seconds.
Turn the motor relay on and check that the pedal does not pulsate.
Turn the motor relay off and release the pedal.

item.ptxt: Be sure to follow the procedures below when turning on a solenoid.
Do not keep a solenoid on for more than 5 seconds. When operating it consecutively, wait 20 seconds between each operation.
The pedal must not be depressed if only the reduction solenoid SFRR, SFLR or SRRR is turned on.

s2.ptxt: With the pedal depressed as much as possible, perform the following operations.

s3.ptxt: Turn the SFRH and SFRR solenoids on simultaneously, and check that the pedal cannot be depressed further.
Turn the SFRH and SFRR solenoids off simultaneously, and check that the pedal can be depressed further.
Turn the motor relay on. Check that the pedal returns to the "depressed as much as possible" position.
Turn the motor relay off and release the pedal.

s2.ptxt: Using the same procedures described for the front right wheel, check the solenoids of the other wheels.
